poem:
"Consumer Lament in Aisle Six"

Sales of the soul in a holiday haze,
A swipe and the heart's austerity pays.
In frenzy we queue, pixel-to-pixel,
Ad to image, in the marketplace digital.
Need becomes want, and want trumps all,
No Romans, no Christians, merely a shopping mall.
In the end, we trade love for merchandise,
Lost in our own retail paradise.
